recipes.name: Potatoes in Thin Gravy (Rassavako Batata)
recipes.description: Gujarati-style potatoes cooked with a mustard-cumin tempering and spices, finished with water to form a thin gravy. Optional onions, tomatoes, and curry leaves can be added.
instructions: Make a tempering (seasoning) with oil, mustard seeds, and cumin seeds.
Add raw or boiled potatoes. Add salt and turmeric and cook for a few minutes.
Add red chilli powder, garam masala, and dhania-jeera powder.
Add water and boil for a few minutes to form a thin gravy.
If using onions, fry onions first, then add potatoes and proceed with the same method.
If using tomatoes, add them after adding all the masalas.
Optionally add curry leaves during tempering; optionally add ginger-chilli-garlic paste (and tomatoes) after adding all masalas.
tips: Fry onions first if adding onions.
Add tomatoes only after adding the masalas.
Curry leaves can be added during tempering.
Ginger-chilli-garlic paste may be added after masalas.

recipes.name: Dry Potato Stir-fry (Sukhi Batata Bhaji)
recipes.description: Dry-style potato sabzi tempered with urad dal, cumin, curry leaves, and green chillies, finished with lemon juice.

ingredients.notes: a little; placed on lid as described

instructions: Heat oil; add urad dal and let it fry briefly.
Add cumin seeds, then add curry leaves and green chillies (as described).
Add potatoes, turmeric, sugar, and salt; cook.
Cover with a lid; place water on the lid and cook on slow gas (low heat) until potatoes are done.
Finish by adding lemon juice.

recipes.name: Milk (Unclear/Partial Recipe)
recipes.description: A partial/unclear entry labeled 'Doodh' with no ingredients or method provided in the text.

recipes.name: Stuffed Brinjal and Potato Bhaji
recipes.description: Brinjals and potatoes sautéed and cooked with a pre-mixed spice stuffing mixture, then pressure-cooked or slow-cooked until tender.

ingredients.notes: cut into big pieces; cut in water
use a little more than usual

instructions: Cut brinjals into big pieces, keeping them in water while cutting.
Mix all masala ingredients (including channa flour, dhania-jeera, haldi, salt, red chilli powder, garam masala, lemon, sugar, and optional coriander/coconut) in a dish and keep aside.
Heat a little more oil than usual; add hing powder.
Add brinjals and potatoes and sauté for some time.
Add the mixed masala and fry for some time.
Add a glassful of water and cook until done: either pressure cook for 2 whistles, or cover and cook on slow gas with water on the lid.
tips: Cut brinjals in water to prevent discoloration.
Can be cooked either in a pressure cooker (2 whistles) or slow-cooked covered with water on the lid.

recipes.name: Bhindi (Okra) with Potatoes
recipes.description: Okra and potatoes cooked with hing and spices, optionally finished with tomatoes, coconut, or ginger-chilli-garlic paste.

ingredients.notes: amount as written; unit not specified

instructions: Heat oil and add hing.
Add bhindi and turmeric and lemon juice; fry for some time.
Add potatoes, cover, and cook on slow gas (low heat) until cooked.
Add salt, red chilli powder, and dhania-jeera powder.
Optionally add ginger-chilli-garlic paste.
Optionally add tomatoes after adding all masala.
Optionally add grated coconut.
tips: Tomatoes are added after all masalas.
Grated coconut can be added.
Ginger-chilli-garlic paste is optional.

recipes.name: Cabbage, Peas, and Potato Sabzi
recipes.description: Cabbage cooked with potatoes and boiled green peas, tempered with cumin and hing, lightly sweetened and spiced.
instructions: Heat oil; add cumin seeds and hing.
Add potatoes and peas, then add cauliflower.
Add turmeric, sugar, and salt; cover and cook on low gas until done.
Add red chilli powder, garam masala, and a little dhania-jeera.
Optionally add chopped tomatoes.
Optionally add ginger-garlic-chilli paste and chopped tomatoes at the end; if adding this paste, do not add sugar.
tips: Chopped tomatoes can be added.
Ginger-garlic-chilli paste can be added at the end; if using it, omit sugar.

recipes.name: Mixed Vegetable Sabzi
recipes.description: A simple mixed vegetable preparation cooked with jeera-hing tempering and basic spices, finished with masalas and optional coconut and ginger-chilli-garlic paste.
instructions: Cut vegetables into big pieces (as indicated for cauliflower).
Heat oil; add cumin seeds and hing.
Add all vegetables.
Add turmeric, salt, and sugar; cover with a lid with some water on it and cook on slow gas until vegetables are cooked.
Add red chilli powder, garam masala, coriander, and coconut.
Optionally add ginger-chilli-garlic paste.
tips: Cook covered on low heat with water placed on the lid (as described).
Ginger-chilli-garlic paste is optional.

recipes.name: Undhiyu (Layered Mixed Vegetable Dish)
recipes.description: Traditional Gujarati layered mixed-vegetable dish cooked in a pressure cooker with a coconut-coriander spice masala, including papdi, potatoes, brinjal, yam, and banana; methi muthia can be added.
instructions: Mix all the masala ingredients together well in a plate and keep ready.
Cut all vegetables separately into big pieces.
Coat each vegetable with a little masala.
For papdi: add soda and carom seeds (ajwain) to papdi, then add masala (also add 1/4 tsp ajwain to papdi).
Heat oil in a pressure cooker; add hing.
Layer vegetables in the cooker: first papdi, then potatoes, then brinjals, then ripe banana (stuff the brinjals and banana with masala).
Pressure cook for 2 whistles on fast gas; check and cook for 1 more whistle if needed.
If all layers do not fit, cook the first layer; steam brinjal and banana separately, then mix them in after other vegetables are cooked.
Optionally add methi muthia either fried, or as an additional layer.
tips: Stuff brinjals and bananas with the masala.
If the cooker is small, steam brinjal and banana separately and mix later.
Methi muthia can be added (fried or layered).

recipes.name: Pani Puri - Spiced Water (Pani)
recipes.description: Tangy coriander-mint pani for pani puri, mixed with water and salt and strained before serving.
instructions: Grind coriander and mint leaves.
Prepare the pani in the morning: combine ground herbs with aamchur powder, khajur amli chutney, sandhal, and ginger-chilli paste; strain and use in the evening.
In a big vessel, fill halfway with water; add the prepared mixture and add salt.
tips: Prepare in the morning, strain, and use in the evening.

recipes.name: Pani Puri - Sweet Tamarind-Date Chutney
recipes.description: Sweet chutney made by pressure-cooking tamarind, dates, and jaggery, then blending and seasoning with spices.
instructions: Boil tamarind, dates, and jaggery in a pressure cooker with 1 glass of water.
Blend and strain the mixture.
Add salt, sandhal, red chilli powder, and 1/4 tsp jeera powder.

recipes.name: Pani Puri Stuffing (Mixed Filling)
recipes.description: A mixed stuffing for pani puri made with boiled/sprouted legumes, potatoes, and boondi, seasoned with chaat spices.
instructions: Combine boiled moong (or sprouted moong), boiled potatoes, boiled black channa, and salted boondi.
Season with salt, chilli powder, coriander, and chaat masala.

recipes.name: Bhel - Green Chutney
recipes.description: A fresh green chutney for bhel made by grinding coriander with green chilli, ginger, curry leaves, and seasonings.
instructions: Blend coriander, spring onion, dill, mint, ginger, green chilies, lemon, and curd into a chutney.
Prepare tempering with mustard seeds, urad dal, and asafoetida.
Add the tempering to the chutney.

recipes.name: Bhel - Garlic Red Chutney
recipes.description: Spicy garlic chutney for bhel made by grinding garlic with red chilli powder, salt, and cumin powder.
instructions: Grind garlic, red chilli powder, salt, and jeera powder to form a paste.

recipes.name: Chaat Masala (Homemade Spice Mix)
recipes.description: A homemade chaat masala blend mixed and stored dry for later use in snacks and chaat.
instructions: Mix all the ingredients together well.
Store in a dry bottle.
tips: Store in a dry bottle.

recipes.name: Hyderabadi Toast (Spiced Potato Toast)
recipes.description: Bread toast topped with a spiced mashed potato paste and finished with chutneys, onions, tomatoes, and sev; garlic chutney is optional.
instructions: Make a paste from boiled potato, salt, lemon, sugar, and garam masala.
Spread the paste on bread.
Toast on a frying pan using a little oil.
Top with sweet chutney and green chutney.
Add onions, tomatoes, and sev on top.
Optionally add garlic chutney.
tips: Garlic chutney can also be added.

recipes.name: Rava Dosa (Semolina Dosa)
recipes.description: Dosa batter made by soaking urad dal and methi seeds and combining with fine rava; dosas are prepared in the evening after fermentation/resting.

ingredients.notes: as needed to make a thin batter

instructions: Mix rava, rice flour, maida, curd, salt, and cumin seeds.
Add water to make a thin batter and rest for a while.
Heat a tawa and grease with oil.
Pour batter and allow it to spread on its own.
Drizzle oil and cook until crisp.
Serve.

recipes.name: Samshar (Dal with Mixed Vegetables and Tempering)
recipes.description: Toovar dal cooked and combined with sautéed mixed vegetables, then finished with a spiced tempering including amli pulp and whole spices.

ingredients.notes: mixed with ghee for sautéing veg
used in veg sautéing; also in dal tempering
used in veg sautéing; also in dal tempering
added after veg are cooked; also mentioned for dal

instructions: Boil the toovar dal and mix it well.
In an oil and ghee mixture, add cumin seeds and hing; add all chopped vegetables and cook until vegetables are cooked.
After vegetables are cooked, add turmeric, salt, and garam masala to the vegetables.
Prepare a tempering for the dal: add cinnamon, cloves, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, whole dry red chillies, and hing.
Add curry leaves, salt, turmeric, red chilli, and amli pulp (1 spoon) to the dal; boil.
Add the sautéed vegetables to the boiled, seasoned dal.

recipes.name: Bhel (components: chutneys)
recipes.description: Notes for making chutneys commonly used in bhel; sweet chutney is referenced from earlier pages, while green and garlic chutneys are specified here.

ingredients.notes: same as above (not provided on these pages)

instructions: Green chutney: Grind coriander, green chilli, ginger, curry leaves, salt, lemon, and sugar to a paste.
Garlic (red) chutney: Grind garlic, red chilli powder, salt, and jeera powder to form a paste.

recipes.name: Samshar (Mixed Vegetable Dal with Tadka)
recipes.description: Toor dal cooked and combined with sautéed mixed vegetables, finished with a spiced tadka and tamarind pulp.

ingredients.notes: for vegetable tempering and dal seasoning

instructions: Boil the toovar dal and mix it well.
In an oil and ghee mixture, add jeera and hing; add all chopped vegetables and cook.
After vegetables are cooked, add haldi, salt, and garam masala to the vegetables.
Prepare dal seasoning (tadka): in fat, add cinnamon, cloves, rai, jeera, dry red whole chillies, and hing.
Add curry leaves, salt, haldi, red chilli, and amli pulp; boil this mixture.
Add the sautéed vegetables into the dal and mix.

recipes.name: Urad Dal (2-whistle method)
recipes.description: Quick urad dal cooked briefly (about 2 whistles) and finished with spices, aromatics, and optional tomato and tadka.
instructions: Boil 1 cup urad dal (about 2 whistles).
Add haldi, salt, red chilli, hing, ginger-chilli paste, coriander, and garlic paste.
Optionally add a seasoning (tadka) of rai and jeera.
Optionally add tomatoes.
tips: You can put seasoning of rai-jeera and you can also add tomatoes.

recipes.name: Pav Bhaji
recipes.description: Boiled mixed vegetables coarsely mashed and cooked with spices and ginger-chilli-garlic paste in oil with cumin and hing.
recipes.prep_time: overnight soaking (only if using black peas)

ingredients.notes: boiled; also used later with potatoes
chopped very small; extra for serving (optional)
very little; also optional at serving

instructions: Pressure cook/boil cauliflower, peas, potatoes, and capsicum.
Chop onions very finely and fry in butter with jeera/hing seasoning.
Add chopped tomatoes and fry; if too dry, add a little water.
When tomatoes are fried, add jeera powder, salt, pav bhaji masala, and a very little garam masala; fry for some time.
Add jeera paste and a little water; fry for some time.
Add the boiled mashed vegetables and some water; fry and cook a little longer.
Adjust seasoning and add fresh coriander leaves.
Serve topped with butter; offer chopped onions, and optionally add salt, lemon, and garam masala.
tips: If the mixture becomes too dry while cooking, add a little water.
At serving, additional salt, lemon, and garam masala can be added to taste.

recipes.name: Urad Dal (Mummy Recipe)
recipes.description: Urad dal cooked and finished with ginger-chilli paste, yogurt, oil, and a ghee-and-clove seasoning.
instructions: Boil the dal.
Add ginger-chilli paste and dahi.
Add oil and a seasoning (tadka) of ghee and clove.

recipes.name: Moong Dal Chillas (with filling paste)
recipes.description: Savory moong dal pancakes made from soaked black moong (with skin) and stuffed with a spiced vegetable paste.

ingredients.notes: mix hing in a little water then add to batter
slight oil for cooking on tava
a little, to adjust paste consistency

instructions: Soak black moong dal (with skin) for 6–8 hours, then grind to a paste.
Keep batter slightly thick but pourable.
Add jeera, salt, and hing (first mix hing in a little water, then add).
On a tava, make small chillas/podas using a little oil.
Flip; after turning, apply the prepared filling paste and fold.
Filling paste: Mix grated boiled peas, grated carrots, ginger, red chilli powder, lemon juice, salt, and fresh coriander; add a little water to make an applicable consistency.

recipes.name: Cold Cucumber Soup
recipes.description: Chilled blended cucumber-and-yogurt soup flavored with mint and green chilli.
instructions: Chop cucumbers into big pieces.
Blend cucumbers with mint leaves, chopped green chillies, a little water, and salt.
Add dahi and blend very well.
Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Cold Salad (Tomato, Capsicum & Yogurt)
recipes.description: Chilled salad of peeled, de-seeded tomatoes and thinly sliced capsicum mixed with salted thickened yogurt and peanuts (optionally coconut).

ingredients.notes: boiled briefly, peeled, de-seeded, cut in long slices
tied in a muslin cloth for some time (to thicken)

instructions: Cut capsicum thin.
Prepare tomatoes: make a cross mark on the bottom of each tomato, boil water, add tomatoes briefly (do not overboil), remove and put in cold water, then peel.
De-seed peeled tomatoes and cut into long slices.
Combine tomatoes and capsicum in a bowl.
Add salt, roasted peanuts, and thickened (hung) dahi; mix well.
Optionally add grated fresh coconut.
Garnish with coriander and serve chilled.
tips: Do not keep tomatoes in boiling water for long, otherwise they will get cooked from inside.
You can also put grated fresh coconut.

recipes.name: Egg & Corn Savoury (Stuffed Eggs)
recipes.description: Boiled eggs stuffed with a creamy corn-vegetable filling piped into halved eggs and garnished with herbs.
instructions: Cut each boiled egg into two and remove the yolk.
Grind boiled corn with grated carrot, boiled grated potato, salt, lime (lemon juice), red chilli powder, and dahi to a paste.
Put the paste into a piping bag.
Fill the egg halves with the paste.
Garnish with mint leaves or coriander.
Optional plating: Make a rose from peeled tomato skin on a plate, surround it with the eggs, pipe the filling using an 8 No. nozzle, and top each with a sprig of mint or coriander.
tips: For serving, you can plate with a rose made of peeled tomato skin and pipe filling using an 8 No. nozzle.

recipes.name: Cabbage Sabzi
recipes.description: Simple cabbage and capsicum stir-fry tempered with mustard oil and hing, seasoned with turmeric, salt, and green chillies.
instructions: Heat mustard oil and add hing.
Add cabbage, capsicum, and spicy green chillies.
Add haldi and salt and cook until done.

recipes.name: Tindora Sabzi
recipes.description: Ivy gourd (tindora) cooked with potatoes and basic spices, finished with additional masala and optional flavorings like lemon and sugar.
instructions: Heat oil and add hing.
Fry potatoes first.
Add tindora, then add haldi and salt.
Cook (instruction note: use a plate covered with water).
When cooked, add red chilli powder.
Optional/mentioned add-ins: dhania-jeera, salt, lemon, sugar, chana flour, garam masala, coriander.
tips: When it cooks, use a plate covered with water (as written).

recipes.name: Choli Sabzi (Black-eyed peas/beans with potatoes)
recipes.description: Potatoes and choli cooked with hing, turmeric, and salt, then finished with chilli and coriander-cumin powder and tomatoes.
instructions: Heat oil and add hing.
Add potatoes and choli; add haldi and salt.
Cook until done.
Add red chilli powder and dhania-jeera.
Add tomatoes and cook.
Add a little sugar if needed.
tips: Add little sugar if needed.

recipes.name: Palak and Potatoes
recipes.description: Spinach and potatoes cooked with a cumin-hing tempering and basic spices; can be made watery by adding water.

ingredients.notes: implied by recipe title; not explicitly listed
optional, if you want it watery

instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add hing and cumin.
Add potatoes, turmeric, and salt; cook covered (lid with water kept on it, as noted).
Add spinach and continue cooking until done.
Add red chili powder and dhania-jeera.
Add water if you want a more watery consistency.
tips: Cover it with a lid on which water is kept (as written).
Add water if you want it watery.

recipes.name: Methi and Potatoes Sabzi
recipes.description: Fenugreek leaves sautéed with hing, then cooked with potatoes, turmeric, salt, and a little water; finished with coriander powder, dhania-jeera, and tomatoes.
instructions: Heat oil in a pan; add hing and rai-jeera.
Add potatoes and dudhi along with a little sugar, turmeric, and salt.
Cook covered until vegetables are cooked.
Add red chili powder and dhania-jeera.
Optionally add tomatoes.
If using onion, fry it first before adding the vegetables.

recipes.name: Drumstick Curry with Buttermilk and Besan
recipes.description: Drumsticks cooked until tender, then simmered in a watery buttermilk-besan mixture seasoned with spices.

ingredients.notes: used in drumsticks and in the buttermilk mix
used in drumsticks and in the buttermilk mix
add more if needed; should be a little watery

instructions: Fry the drumsticks in oil with hing for some time.
Add water, turmeric, and salt; cover with a lid and cook until the drumsticks are tender.
In a bowl, mix channa flour into buttermilk and add turmeric, salt, sugar, dhania-jeera, and red chili powder.
Add this buttermilk-besan mixture to the cooked drumsticks.
Adjust consistency to be slightly watery; add more buttermilk if needed and simmer to combine.

recipes.name: Tuver Dal with Rice (Dal-Chawal Style)
recipes.description: Tuver dal cooked and tempered with rai, methi, and hing, seasoned with jaggery and lemon; rice is cooked along with/after adding the tempering and spices.
instructions: Boil the tuver dal.
Prepare the tempering: heat oil and add rai, methi seeds, and hing (optionally add clove and cinnamon or red chilies).
Add the spices/seasonings (salt, red chili powder, turmeric, jaggery, curry leaves, and lemon) and the tempering to the boiled dal.
Cook the rice as directed ('Then cook the rice').

recipes.name: Lachko Dal (Loose Tuver Dal)
recipes.description: Tuver dal boiled with extra water to a loose consistency, then tempered and cooked to thicken without becoming too thick.

ingredients.notes: boil dal in a little more water
text says 'Then do tempering' without listing ingredients
text says 'Then add spices' without listing beyond those above

instructions: Boil the tuver dal in a little more water to keep it loose.
Do the tempering.
Add spices and continue cooking.
Let it thicken while cooking; do not make it too thick.

recipes.name: Mixed Dal
recipes.description: A blend of mixed lentils boiled together, lightly blended, spiced, and tempered with rai and hing.

ingredients.notes: moong dal, channa dal, tuvar dal, udad dal; NOTE says all dals together should come up to 1 cup (conflicting)

instructions: Boil all the dals together.
Blend the cooked dals a little.
Add ginger, green chilies, red chili powder, turmeric, salt, and a little garam masala.
Prepare tempering with oil, rai, and hing, and add it to the dal; season and serve.
tips: NOTE: All the dals together should come up to 1 cup (as written), though the recipe also states 1 1/2 cup total dal.

recipes.name: Moong Dal (Saragwalo Moong)
recipes.description: Boiled moong dal seasoned with ginger, green chilies, spices, jaggery and lemon, finished with a mustard-cumin tempering in oil and ghee.
instructions: Boil the moong until cooked.
Prepare tempering: add mustard seeds first, then add the rest of the tempering ingredients (cumin, oil, ghee).
Add ginger, green chilies, salt, turmeric, red chili powder, jaggery, and lemon to the dal.
Mix well and serve.

recipes.name: Sprouted Moong (Ankurit Moong)
recipes.description: Overnight-sprouted moong boiled and tempered in oil, then seasoned with spices; a simple nourishing preparation.
instructions: Soak the moong in the evening and keep it to sprout overnight.
Boil the sprouted moong until cooked.
Heat oil (about 2 tsp) and add tempering (not specified beyond oil).
Add the boiled sprouts and add red chili powder, salt, turmeric, coriander-cumin powder, and a little sugar.
Bring to a boil and serve.
tips: Variation: Same as above, but do not add green chilies.

recipes.name: Saragwali Chokhi (Amla-Version of Dal)
recipes.description: Prepared using the same method as the dal, but using amla instead of lemon and a simple mustard-seed tempering.

ingredients.notes: type/quantity not specified; 'same method as dal'

instructions: Cook the dal using the same method as the referenced dal recipe.
Use amla instead of lemon.
Prepare tempering with oil, mustard seeds, and ghee, and add it to the dal.

recipes.name: Amla Tuver Dal (Amla Tufar)
recipes.description: Tuver dal variation made like the regular dal but flavored with amla instead of lemon; dal is soaked overnight and cooked in the morning.
instructions: Soak the dal overnight.
Cook it in the morning.
Follow the same method as the dal recipe but use amla instead of lemon.
Prepare tempering with oil, mustard seeds, and ghee and add to the dal.

recipes.name: Saragwali Chokh ni Dal
recipes.description: Boiled dal seasoned with ginger and green chilies and finished with a mustard-seed tempering in oil and ghee.
instructions: Boil the dal until cooked.
Add ginger, green chilies, and ghee (masala) to the dal.
Prepare tempering with oil, mustard seeds, and ghee and add it to the dal.
Mix and serve.

recipes.name: Fried Dal (Mung Dal)
recipes.description: Simple sautéed mung dal fried with onion in oil and ghee.

ingredients.notes: soaked (text also says cooked/soaked dal when frying)

instructions: Heat oil and ghee.
Add the onion and sauté until light brown.
Add the cooked/soaked mung dal and fry.

recipes.name: Spicy Mung Dal
recipes.description: Pressure-cooked mung dal seasoned with red chili powder, salt, and hing, with a small oil-ghee-hing tempering.

ingredients.notes: enough to boil; plus a little water with spices

instructions: Soak the dal 1 hour beforehand.
Wash the dal, add enough water, and boil in a pressure cooker.
Add red chili powder, salt, hing, and a little water.
Cook in the pressure cooker until one whistle.

recipes.name: Kathiyawadi Chokhi (Peanut Curry/Gravy)
recipes.description: Kathiyawadi-style peanut-based gravy cooked with onions, tomatoes, spices, and herbs, then simmered; boiled peanuts and potato are used to build body and thickness.

ingredients.notes: boiled; also used to thicken gravy
soaked, then cooked in pressure cooker
includes 1 tsp salt while pressure cooking peanuts
for cooking peanuts and adjusting gravy consistency

instructions: Soak peanuts (soaking overnight is better).
Pressure cook the peanuts with enough water and about 1 tsp salt; cook for 5–6 whistles, lowering the gas after 4 whistles and completing the remaining whistles on slow flame.
To make the gravy, heat oil and add hing.
Add onions and sauté until brown.
Add tomatoes, then add the spices (coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala, salt).
Add a little water and add the boiled potatoes.
Add chopped onion, green chilies, coriander, and salt.
Crush/blend the mixture in a mixer.
Add the crushed peanuts (and/or peanut powder).
Cook the gravy after blending; add water if needed to adjust consistency.
Simmer on slow gas for 10 minutes.
tips: If peanuts are soaked the previous night, it will be better.
If you add boiled potato, the gravy becomes thick.
After crushing in the mixer, cook the gravy and add water if needed.
Simmer on slow gas for 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Kathiyawadi Chokhi (Peanut-Based Gravy)
recipes.description: A Kathiyawadi-style peanut gravy cooked with onions, tomatoes, spices, and potatoes, simmered until thick.

ingredients.notes: plus additional chopped onion mentioned later
listed in ingredients; peanuts are also later crushed
includes 1 tsp salt while boiling peanuts
for boiling peanuts and adjusting gravy consistency

instructions: Soak peanuts (overnight preferred).
Pressure cook the peanuts with enough water and 1 tsp salt for 5–6 whistles; after 4 whistles, lower the heat and take remaining whistles on low heat.
Heat oil and add asafoetida.
Add onions and sauté until brown.
Add tomatoes, then add the spices and mix.
Add a little water and add the boiled potatoes.
Add chopped onion, green chilies, coriander, and salt.
Crush the mixture in a mixer.
Add the crushed peanuts to the gravy.
Cook the gravy; add water if needed to adjust consistency.
Simmer on low heat for 10 minutes.
tips: If you add boiled potato, the gravy becomes thick.
After crushing in the mixer, cook the gravy and add water if needed.

recipes.name: Spinach in Kathiyawadi Gravy (Palak)
recipes.description: Spinach cooked in the same peanut-onion-tomato gravy as Kathiyawadi Chokhi, finished with ghee.

ingredients.notes: add a little when it boils

instructions: Prepare the same gravy as Kathiyawadi Chokhi.
Add spinach to the gravy.
If you choose to crush the gravy in a mixer, also crush the spinach.
When it comes to a boil, add a little ghee.
For tempering, use oil and asafoetida as needed.
tips: If it becomes too watery, make a thin, lump-free paste of chickpea flour (besan) with a little water and add it to the gravy; do not blend in the mixer—boil to thicken.

recipes.name: White Pulao
recipes.description: A mild pulao cooked with peas and whole spices, using a 1:3 rice-to-water ratio.

ingredients.notes: per 1 cup rice (ratio stated: 1 cup rice : 3 cups water)

instructions: Heat ghee; add cumin, cloves, and green chilies.
Add onion and sauté.
When onion is well sautéed, add rice and sauté slowly.
Add peas (vatana) and salt, then add water.
Cook in a cooker; if using a pressure cooker, cook for 1 whistle.

recipes.name: Yellow Pulao
recipes.description: A spiced pulao with tomatoes, peas, and warming masalas, finished with ketchup.
recipes.cook_time: 7–8 minutes (masala cooking) + pressure cooking (time not specified)

ingredients.notes: added during cooking and also used for tempering

instructions: Heat ghee; add cumin, cardamom, and green chilies.
Add onion and sauté until well sautéed.
Add tomatoes, mix, and sauté.
Add peas/vatana and all masalas except salt; sauté and cook for 7–8 minutes.
Add rice and sauté slowly.
Add ghee, then add water and salt.
Cook in a cooker.

recipes.name: Vegetable Biryani (Pressure Cooker)
recipes.description: A pressure-cooker vegetable biryani with fried onions and potatoes, mixed vegetables, biryani masala, curd, and whole spices.
instructions: In oil, fry the onion and potatoes.
When the onion becomes light pink, add carrots and peas.
Mix well; add boiled peas, potatoes, and carrots, then add biryani masala and curd.
Mix again and let it cook for a while.
Add the soaked rice and water, then add cloves and cinnamon.
Cook in a cooker.
tips: Alternative order: first add rice to water; when the water boils, add carrot, peas, and potatoes.
After 5 minutes, reduce the heat and let it cook.
After 10–15 minutes, remove the rice in a strainer.

recipes.name: Cooked Rice (Direct, with Tempering)
recipes.description: Simple cooked rice prepared in a cooker with spices and a tempering of whole spices.
instructions: Heat oil and make the tempering with cumin, black pepper, and cinnamon.
Add the soaked rice and water, and add masala.
Cook in a cooker.

recipes.name: Vagharelo Bhaat (Tempered Rice)
recipes.description: Cooked rice mixed with masala and finished with a mustard-asafoetida tempering, then gently steamed on low heat.
instructions: Mix the masala mix into the rice.
Prepare the tempering with oil, mustard seeds, and asafoetida, then add it to the rice.
Cover and keep on low heat for 5 minutes.

recipes.name: Limbu Bhaat (Lemon Rice)
recipes.description: Tempered rice flavored with peanuts, turmeric, and lemon juice.
instructions: Heat oil; add mustard seeds and curry leaves, then add the ginger.
When the tempering is ready, add peanuts.
Add the rice.
Add salt, turmeric, and lemon.

recipes.name: Khoto Bhaat (Curd Rice Variation)
recipes.description: A simple variation of tempered rice made by mixing curd into vagharelo bhaat.
instructions: Prepare vagharelo bhaat.
Mix in 2–3 tbsp curd to make khoto bhaat.

recipes.name: Vaghareli Khichdi
recipes.description: Rice and tuvar dal khichdi seasoned with turmeric and chili, finished with a mustard-asafoetida tempering, made in the style of vagharelo bhaat.
instructions: Prepare the khichdi using the same method as Vagharelo Bhaat (mix seasonings, add tempering, then cover and cook briefly on low heat).

recipes.name: Khichdi (Moong Dal)
recipes.description: A simple moong dal and rice khichdi made using the same approach as vagharelo bhaat, with ghee and cloves as the tempering.
instructions: Prepare using the same method as Vagharelo Bhaat.

recipes.name: Khamaani Khichdi
recipes.description: A hearty khichdi with sautéed onions and potatoes, green chilies, and moong dal-rice cooked together, finished with an additional tempering on top.

ingredients.notes: add more if you want it more watery

instructions: Prepare the vaghar (tempering) in oil with mustard seeds and asafoetida.
Add onions and potatoes and sauté the onions well.
Add green chilies and sauté for 2 minutes.
Add moong dal and washed rice.
Add turmeric, red chili powder, salt, and 5–6 cups water.
Stir once and cook on medium flame.
When it boils, reduce the flame to low, cover with a lid, and let it cook until the water is absorbed.
Mix, then do an additional vaghar on top.
If you want it more watery, add water.
tips: Adjust consistency by adding more water if you prefer a more watery khichdi.
Finish with an extra tempering on top after cooking.

recipes.name: Tempered Khichdi (Toor Dal & Rice)
recipes.description: A simple Gujarati khichdi made with toor dal and rice, finished with a mustard-seed tempering.
instructions: Prepare using the same method as Vagharelo Bhaat (as referenced in the source text).

recipes.name: Besan Curry (Gram Flour Curry)
recipes.description: A simple curry made by roasting flour in a tempered base and simmering with buttermilk/chaas and spices.

ingredients.notes: mentioned in method but not listed in ingredients

instructions: Heat oil for tempering and fry the onions and chilies.
When the onions turn light red, add the flour and roast it.
Add 1/2 cup water.
When it comes to a boil, add ghee, then add salt and spices.

recipes.name: Dum Aloo
recipes.description: Potatoes cooked in a thick onion-garlic and tomato masala gravy seasoned with dum aloo masala.
instructions: Heat oil; add a little ginger-garlic paste and cook until light pinkish.
Add onion paste and fry well.
Add tomato paste and fry until oil leaves the sides.
Add haldi and Navalkar curry masala to make the gravy base.
To prepare in water: add potatoes, peas, and salt.
Mix the prepared gravy paste with a little water and add it to the potatoes and peas.
Add a little curry leaves and coriander.
tips: Can be made with onions and potatoes.

recipes.name: Onion-Potato Vegetable
recipes.description: A simple Gujarati sabzi of onions and potatoes cooked with mustard tempering, ginger, green chilies, and spices.

ingredients.notes: listed twice; includes 1 tsp at end
use as tamarind water; added last
add to boil and to make tamarind water

instructions: Heat oil; add onions (and other aromatics as written) and sauté.
Add potatoes, turmeric, chickpea flour, and potato masala; sauté.
Add besan and other spices; sauté.
Add water and boil.
Add tamarind water at the end and finish the potato vegetable.

recipes.name: Aloo Methi (Potato with Fenugreek Leaves)
recipes.description: Boiled potatoes cooked with garlic, green chilies, and fresh methi leaves, lightly tempered and simmered until flavorful.
instructions: Heat oil and add cumin for tempering.
Add cut pieces of garlic, then add potatoes and methi leaves.
Fry onion, then add potatoes and methi and cook.
After some time, add tomatoes according to taste.
After adding methi, add turmeric, red chili powder, and coriander powder (no garam masala).
Cook for 10–15 minutes.
tips: Do not add garam masala (as noted).

recipes.name: Curd Chana Dal
recipes.description: Chana dal cooked with curd and spices, finished with a curry-leaf and hing tempering for a tangy, spiced dal preparation.
instructions: Cook the curd and chana dal together in a cooker.
Add the other spices and cook again.
Add the tempering, then remove from heat.
tips: Do not add too much water to the curd.
If the curd is thick and water is needed, add only a little water.

recipes.name: Green Banana (Raw Banana) Vegetable
recipes.description: A savory curry of raw bananas and onions cooked with spices and finished with tamarind for tang.
instructions: Heat the tempering.
Add onions and raw bananas and sauté.
Add the masalas.
Add a little water and cover.
Once cooked, add tamarind.

recipes.name: Stuffed Raw Banana
recipes.description: Raw bananas stuffed with a spicy besan-based filling, then sautéed and cooked until tender on a tawa or in a pressure cooker.

ingredients.notes: quantity not specified; used for stuffing

instructions: Mix all the filling (masala) ingredients and keep ready.
Stuff the raw bananas with the masala.
Heat oil; add the stuffed raw bananas and sauté.
Add a little water and cover.
Cook either on a tawa or in a cooker for 3–4 whistles.
tips: Can be cooked on a tawa or in a pressure cooker (3–4 whistles).

recipes.name: Fried Potatoes
recipes.description: Boiled potatoes cut into pieces and (implied) seasoned/tempered with spices, curry leaves, and a sweet-sour finish.
instructions: Boil the potatoes and cut into pieces.

recipes.name: Potato Bhaji and Bhungla Bhaji (General Method)
recipes.description: A basic method describing how to prep and partially cook sliced potatoes and bhungla (green pods) for bhaji-style vegetables.
instructions: Wash the potatoes and slice/cut into pieces.
Wash the bhungla (green pods), remove the strings, and wash again.
Cook the bhungla on low heat on the stove for a little while.
Cook the cut potatoes on low heat on the gas.

recipes.name: Methi Potato Curry
recipes.description: Potatoes cooked with onions, a little methi, spices, and finished with curd stirred in after boiling.
instructions: Wash and cut the potatoes into small pieces.
Chop the methi and wash it.
Add the spices and 1/2 bowl water.
When it boils, add the curd and mix.

recipes.name: Sukhi Bhaji (Dry Potato Curry)
recipes.description: A dry-style potato and onion curry cooked covered on low heat with basic Gujarati spices and tempering.
instructions: Wash and cut the potatoes and onions.
Mix and keep covered; cook on low heat.

recipes.name: Rasavala Bataka (Potatoes with Gravy)
recipes.description: Potatoes cooked with spices into a gravy, finished with jaggery and tamarind added after the potatoes are cooked.
instructions: Wash and cut the potatoes.
Chop all the masalas except jaggery and tamarind.
Cook the potatoes with the spices.
After the potatoes are cooked, add jaggery and tamarind.
tips: Add jaggery and tamarind only after the potatoes are cooked.

recipes.name: Batakanu Chhatvalnu Shaak
recipes.description: A potato curry cooked with basic spices and finished by adding tempering/spices as it boils.
instructions: Wash and cut the potatoes.
When the potatoes are a little cooked, add turmeric and chilli powder.
When it starts to boil, add mustard, coriander powder, and salt.

recipes.name: Fenugreek Potato Curry
recipes.description: Potato curry cooked with methi (fenugreek leaves), spices, and finished with curd for a tangy, creamy taste.

ingredients.notes: washed and cut into small pieces

instructions: Wash and cut the potatoes into small pieces.
Chop the methi and wash it.
Add spices and 1/2 bowl water; bring to a boil.
Add the curd and mix.

recipes.name: Potatoes in Tamarind-Jaggery Gravy
recipes.description: Potato sabzi with a sweet-sour gravy made by adding jaggery and tamarind after the potatoes cook.
instructions: Wash and cut the potatoes.
Chop/prepare all masalas except jaggery and tamarind and cook the potatoes with spices.
After the potatoes are cooked, add jaggery and tamarind and mix.

recipes.name: Split/Slit Potato Shaak
recipes.description: A simple potato sabzi where spices are added as the potatoes partially cook and the dish is brought to a boil.
instructions: Wash and cut the potatoes.
When the potatoes are a little cooked, add turmeric and chilli powder.
When it starts to boil, add mustard, coriander powder, and salt.

recipes.name: Green Peas and Onion Dry Sabzi (Kopra-Style)
recipes.description: Dry-style peas and onions cooked with a spiced tempering and finished with a little water for doneness.
instructions: Chop onions into long pieces.
Heat oil; add onions and cook until they turn red.
Add peas.
Add all spices, cover, and cook on low heat for 2–3 minutes.
Add a little water and cook until done.
tips: Using the same masala method, you can make tasty vegetable dishes with peas and onions and other vegetables too.

recipes.name: Black Peas Masala
recipes.description: Black peas and onions cooked in a tempered spice base and simmered with water into a masala-style sabzi.
instructions: Heat oil with mustard seeds and cumin seeds (tempering).
Add black peas and onions.
Add spices and sauté well.
Add water and cook.

recipes.name: Dry Tomato Sabzi
recipes.description: Quick sautéed tomato sabzi cooked with simple spices and a ghee-cumin tempering.
instructions: Heat ghee and cumin seeds (tempering).
Add tomatoes.
Add spices and sauté.
When it releases aroma, remove and serve.

recipes.name: Tomato, Peas, and Onion Sabzi
recipes.description: A gravy-style mixed sabzi of peas and onions simmered with tomatoes and finished with red chili powder.
instructions: Heat oil with mustard seeds and cumin seeds (tempering).
Add peas and onions and sauté.
Add all spices except red chili powder and add 2 bowls of water.
When it starts boiling, add chopped medium-size tomatoes.
When it boils again, add red chili powder and cook.

recipes.name: Eggplant, Potato, and Tomato Sabzi
recipes.description: A variation of the potato-tomato sabzi where eggplant pieces are added along with potatoes.

ingredients.notes: cut into pieces; add with potatoes

instructions: Prepare the dish the same way as the Batata-Bataka-Tameta recipe, adding eggplant pieces along with the potatoes.

recipes.name: Cauliflower and Potato Sabzi
recipes.description: Cauliflower-potato sabzi with peas, mild sweetness, and a mustard-hing tempering, cooked using the same method as cabbage-bataka.
instructions: Cook using the same method as Cabbage Batata (Kobi Bataka).

recipes.name: French Beans and Potato (Pressure Cooker)
recipes.description: French beans and potatoes cooked with oil, salt, and ajwain, pressure-cooked with minimal water for a dry sabzi.
instructions: Remove strings from the beans and cut them.
Mix oil, salt, and ajwain.
Add the beans and potatoes, sprinkle a little water, and cover (do not cover fully).
Cook in a pressure cooker for 3–4 whistles.
tips: Do not cover fully while cooking in the pressure cooker.

recipes.name: Green Choliya Sabzi
recipes.description: Green choliya cooked with mustard-hing tempering and basic spices, simmered slowly and stirred occasionally.

ingredients.notes: mentioned in method; quantity not specified

instructions: Heat oil with mustard seeds and hing (tempering).
Add chopped choliya.
Add peas, then add spices.
Cover and cook; add a little water if needed.
Keep on medium gas and stir occasionally.
Cook for 1/2 hour on low gas.

recipes.name: Moong (Simple Tempered Moong)
recipes.description: Soaked moong cooked with a mustard-hing tempering and basic spices.
instructions: Soak moong in water for 1/2 hour.
Heat oil with mustard seeds and hing (tempering).
Add moong and add the spices.
Cook until done.

recipes.name: Cabbage Vegetable (Pressure Cooker + Tempering)
recipes.description: Cabbage and potatoes pressure-cooked with salt, then sautéed in a mustard-hing tempering.
instructions: Pressure cook the cabbage and potatoes with salt for 4 whistles, then switch off the gas.
Heat oil; add mustard seeds and hing.
Add the cooked cabbage and potatoes and sauté.

recipes.name: Semi-Ripe Guava Vegetable
recipes.description: Guava and potato curry cooked in water with spices and peanuts, with sugar added only after cooling.
instructions: Cook guava pieces and potatoes in 4 cups water.
Add oil and all spices except sugar.
Do not cover while cooking.
Add sugar after it cools.
tips: Do not cover while cooking.
Add sugar only after the dish cools.

recipes.name: Dhakli Shaak (Flatbread Pieces Cooked with Spiced Water)
recipes.original_name: Bhuna Chokha na Dhakli na Shak
recipes.description: Wheat dough flavored with peanuts and spices is rolled, spiced, cut into pieces (dhakli), then simmered until cooked through and finished with garam masala.

ingredients.notes: mentioned in method; not listed in ingredients
mentioned in method; not listed in ingredients
for dough and for spice mixture (includes 1/2 bowl water for spice mixture)

instructions: Make a dough with wheat flour, salt, ajwain, turmeric, peanuts, red chili powder, oil, and water; knead well.
In 1/2 bowl water, prepare a spice mixture (red chili powder, salt, turmeric) and spread it on the rolled dough.
Cut into pieces to make dhakli.
Cook on medium heat for 15 minutes, then add garam masala and cook 5 minutes more.

recipes.name: Sakvadi (Besan and Chickpeas Curry)
recipes.description: A thick besan gravy cooked with chickpeas, sweetened with jaggery/sugar, tangy with lemon, and finished with a mustard-cumin-hing tempering.
instructions: Roast the besan in ghee/oil, then add 3 bowls water and cook well.
Add the cooked chickpeas and bring to a boil.
Add red chili powder, salt, turmeric, and jaggery (or sugar); let it boil.
Add lemon juice at the end and simmer for 15 minutes on medium heat.
Do not cover while cooking.
If it sticks, cook in a non-stick or aluminium pan.
tips: Do not cover while cooking.
If it sticks, use a non-stick/aluminium pan.

recipes.name: Flatbread with Dal Stuffing (Dhakli Shaak)
recipes.original_name: Bhuna Chokha na Dhakli na Shak
recipes.description: Gujarati dhakli-style dish where spiced dough pieces are cooked and finished with garam masala.

ingredients.notes: mentioned in dough step and spice-water mixture
for dough and spice-water mixture; includes 1/2 bowl water for spice mixture

instructions: Make a dough with wheat flour, salt, ajwain, turmeric, coarsely ground peanuts, red chili powder, oil, and water; knead well.
Make a spice-water mixture using 1/2 bowl water with red chili powder, salt, and turmeric; spread it over the rolled dough.
Cut into pieces and shape into dhakli pieces.
Cook on medium heat for 15 minutes.
Add garam masala and cook 5 minutes more.

recipes.name: Green Tuvar Bean Vegetable
recipes.description: Pressure-cooked green tuvar (pigeon peas) vegetable made with a spiced tempering and finished with cloves after cooling.
instructions: Prepare tempering with oil, mustard seeds, asafoetida, and add all spices except cloves.
Transfer to a pressure cooker with tuvar and onion; add 1/2 bowl water and cook for 2 whistles.
After the cooker cools, add cloves and boil.

recipes.name: Green Tuvar with Vadli / Surti Papdi Vegetable
recipes.original_name: Ringna Vadaar ane Surti Papdi nu Shaak
recipes.description: A variation of the green tuvar vegetable; instructions indicate it is prepared the same way as the basic tuvar shaak.

ingredients.notes: as per Green Tuvar Bean Vegetable
as per Green Tuvar Bean Vegetable
as per Green Tuvar Bean Vegetable
as per Green Tuvar Bean Vegetable
as per Green Tuvar Bean Vegetable
as per Green Tuvar Bean Vegetable
as per Green Tuvar Bean Vegetable
as per Green Tuvar Bean Vegetable
as per Green Tuvar Bean Vegetable
mentioned as variation; quantity not specified
mentioned in title; details not specified

instructions: Prepare this dish using the same ingredients and method as the Green Tuvar Bean Vegetable.

recipes.name: Fish Curry (Besan-based)
recipes.description: Fish pieces cooked with a mustard-hing tempering and thickened with besan and spices.

ingredients.notes: for tempering (in addition to pinch listed)
add a little as needed while boiling

instructions: Cut fish into medium-size pieces.
Heat oil for tempering; add mustard seeds and asafoetida.
Add fish, turmeric, and salt; stir to coat. Cover and cook.
Add a little water and boil.
Add remaining spices (including cloves and black pepper) and add besan; mix well.
Boil on low heat, adding a little water as needed, keeping it covered, for about 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Tadkava (Tempering Buttermilk Drink/Gravy)
recipes.description: A tempered buttermilk preparation flavored with pepper and hing, brought to a boil and served hot.
instructions: Heat oil; add tadkava, black pepper, and hing.
When it starts to fry, add water.
Add 1/2 bowl buttermilk and more water.
Bring to a boil; add salt and hing and serve.

recipes.name: Chevdo (Poha Chivda)
recipes.description: A large-batch Gujarati poha chevdo/chivda with fried peanuts, sev, coconut slices, curry leaves, and lemon juice.
instructions: Sun-dry the poha for 4–5 hours.
Heat oil and fry peanuts until done; remove.
Fry curry leaves; remove.
Fry sev (gathiya); remove.
Fry dry coconut slices until lightly golden; remove.
In a large bowl, mix turmeric, hing, sugar, and salt. Add all fried items and mix thoroughly.
Add lemon juice, mix well, and keep covered for about 90 minutes.
Mix again and store.

recipes.name: Bread Roll
recipes.description: Fried bread rolls stuffed with a spiced potato mixture and herbs.
instructions: Mash boiled potatoes; add salt and spices and mix.
Add finely chopped onion, green chilies, and coriander; mix.
Dip bread slices in water and squeeze out excess water.
Fill bread with the potato mixture, shape into rolls, and fry until done.

recipes.name: Kimi Aunty’s Large Potatoes
recipes.description: Tempered potato preparation with onions, green chilies, garlic, lemon, and ajwain; optional dry coconut.

ingredients.notes: note: title says '6 Large Potatoes' but ingredient list states 4 potatoes

instructions: Mix potatoes with salt, turmeric, lemon, and ajwain.
Heat 2 tsp oil; add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
Add onions and (optional) grated dry coconut; sauté.
Add green chilies and garlic; sauté.
Add the potatoes; mix and cook.
Stir in the tempering and serve.
tips: Optional: add grated dry coconut.

recipes.name: Green Tuvar Pigeon Pea Kachori Filling
recipes.description: Savory cooked green tuvar filling flavored with coconut, green chilies, lemon, sugar, and coriander for stuffing kachoris.
instructions: Soak the tuvar overnight.
Heat 4–5 tsp oil; add soaked tuvar and sauté on low heat, stirring, until cooked (about 15 minutes).
Add coconut, green chilies, lemon, sugar, salt, and coriander; mix well.
Use the mixture as kachori filling and make kachoris.

recipes.name: Palak Vada
recipes.description: Crisp fried vadas made from mixed flours, onions, ginger, chilies, and lemon juice.

ingredients.notes: listed separately from besan as written
add as needed to make batter (just before frying)

instructions: Mix spices and a little oil together.
Add green chili, salt, lemon juice, and baking soda; mix well.
Add ginger and chopped onion; mix.
Just before frying, add water as needed to make a batter.
Fry vadas in hot oil.
tips: For a smaller quantity, reduce green chili, ginger, etc. accordingly.
If making half quantity, make the batter accordingly.

recipes.name: Makki na Chevda (Cornflakes Chivda)
recipes.description: Fried cornflakes snack mix tempered with mustard seeds and mixed with seasonings; ingredient quantities vary by number of packets used.

ingredients.notes: base case as written (alternative quantities given for 4 packets)
alternative version for 4 packets as written

instructions: Fry the cornflakes.
Heat oil in a pan; add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add the remaining listed ingredients and mix well.
tips: Quantities vary depending on whether using 2 packets or 4 packets of cornflakes (as written).

recipes.name: Ghaav Slo (Wheat Slo) - Notes
recipes.description: Partial notes for a wheat-based preparation (possibly served like dahi vada style per notes), involving soaking and slow cooking to thicken.

ingredients.notes: keep adding as needed; mentions 'about 1 liter' but context unclear

instructions: Optionally soak in milk (as written).
Soak the wheat (ghaav slo).
After soaking, when it becomes thick, soak it for about 1 liter (as written; exact meaning unclear).
Cook on low heat; later soak/keep again on 'ghaav' as written.
Keep adding water as needed and keep stirring.
Keep coriander on hand (as written).

recipes.name: Bhajiya (Basic)
recipes.description: Partial recipe for basic bhajiya batter using chickpea flour, spices, salt, and baking soda.

recipes.name: Kanda Bhajiya (Onion Pakora)
recipes.description: Crisp onion bhajiyas made with a thick chickpea flour batter and fried on medium heat.

ingredients.notes: add a little to make a thick batter

instructions: Mix spices into the chickpea flour.
Add sliced onions and mix well (do not add too much water).
Add a little water and make a thick batter.
Fry in hot oil on medium flame until done.
tips: Keep the flame on medium while frying.
Do not add too much water; batter should be thick.

recipes.name: Dhokla (with dal and potatoes)
recipes.description: Steamed savory cakes made from a ground chana dal and urad dal batter with mashed potatoes and spices.

ingredients.notes: listed; also mentions adding 1/4 tsp while making (as written)
plus 3 tsp added to batter while making

instructions: Soak chana dal and urad dal overnight; grind to a batter.
In the morning, boil potatoes and mash them.
Add everything to the batter except curd and oil; make a normal batter (not too thin).
While making, mix in 3 tsp oil and 1/4 tsp curd (as written).
Grease the steamer plate with oil.
Steam the batter in the greased plate until cooked through.
tips: For a spicier version, add more green chilies and 2 tsp curd to the batter (as written).

recipes.name: Instant Dhokla
recipes.description: Quick steamed besan dhokla leavened with Eno/citric acid and finished with a sweet-salty tempering water.

ingredients.item: Eno fruit salt or citric acid

instructions: Mix besan, rava/rice flour, salt, sugar, and water to make a smooth batter.
Add Eno fruit salt and mix.
Grease the dhokla plate/tray.
Steam the batter in the greased plate until set (steaming time not specified).
Prepare tempering water: in 1/2 cup water add 1 tsp sugar, mustard seeds, hing, curry leaves, and oil.
Pour the tempering water over the steamed dhokla.
Cut into pieces and serve, garnished with coriander and lemon.

recipes.name: Idli Mixture (Steamed savory cake)
recipes.description: A steamed idli-like batter made from rice flour and maida with spices and curd, rested then steamed on medium heat.

ingredients.notes: a little, as required; plus for greasing

instructions: Mix maida and all spices into the flour.
Mix in the curd.
Add water as needed to make a batter.
Cover and rest the batter.
Grease a plate and pour in the batter.
Steam on medium heat until cooked.
Remove and let cool slightly before serving.

recipes.name: Patra
recipes.description: Steamed colocasia (arvi) leaf rolls coated with a sweet-tangy spiced besan paste, then sliced and sautéed with mustard and sesame.

ingredients.notes: boil in water and strain for pulp; or use lemon

instructions: Boil green tamarind in water, strain, and keep the pulp (or use lemon juice).
Mix besan with sour buttermilk/water to make a batter; add tamarind pulp (or lemon), jaggery, red chilli powder, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt; mix smooth.
Lay out an arvi leaf, spread batter on it, place another leaf on top and repeat to stack; roll tightly.
Bring water to a boil in a steamer setup; place a stand/plate inside and steam the rolls (do not put rolls directly in water).
Cool the steamed rolls and cut into pieces.
Heat oil; add mustard seeds and sesame seeds. Add the pieces and sauté; cook for about 20 minutes.
Serve.
tips: Do not use black-stem arvi leaves.
Do not place rolls directly in water while steaming; steam on a stand/plate.

recipes.name: Batata Pudla (Potato Pudla)
recipes.description: A spiced potato-onion mixture cooked after a mustard-hing tempering; cooked gently to avoid burning.

ingredients.notes: boiled; soak in water 15 minutes before (as written)

instructions: Soak the boiled potatoes in water about 15 minutes before starting (as written).
Make tempering: heat oil and add mustard seeds and hing.
Add onion, green chillies, and potatoes.
Add cumin seeds, lemon, red chilli powder, salt, and turmeric; mix well.
Cook on a slow flame for 5–10 minutes.
tips: Cook on low flame; high flame may burn.

recipes.name: Raw Papaya Pudla (same method as Batata Pudla)
recipes.description: A spiced raw papaya preparation cooked using the same method as Batata Pudla with mustard-hing tempering.
instructions: Prepare using the same method as Batata Pudla: temper oil with mustard seeds and hing, add onions and green chillies, add papaya, season with spices and lemon, and cook on low flame until done.

recipes.name: Khichdi (Simple Rice Khichdi)
recipes.description: A very simple khichdi-style rice dish cooked in water with salt, turmeric, cumin, and oil until soft.
recipes.cook_time: 5–10 minutes (covered on slow flame after cooking)
instructions: Boil the water.
Add rice, salt, turmeric, and cumin seeds; add oil and mix.
Stir while cooking; add more water if needed and continue cooking until rice is cooked.
Cover and cook on slow flame for 5–10 minutes.
Serve hot; if watery, cook a little longer.
tips: If the khichdi is watery, cook a bit more to thicken.

recipes.name: Upma
recipes.description: A basic upma made by roasting semolina and cooking it with a mustard-seed tempering, chilies, tomatoes, curry leaves, and lemon.
instructions: Roast the rava (semolina).
Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds.
Proceed with tempering and cook upma using the listed ingredients (water, green chillies, tomatoes, curry leaves, salt, lemon).

recipes.name: Soft Rice Cooked in Water
recipes.description: Basic method for cooking rice in boiling water until soft, then optionally draining the water.
recipes.cook_time: about 10 minutes (as written; varies by soaking)
instructions: Heat water in a large vessel until it comes to a boil.
Add rice (soaked rice will cook faster; unsoaked rice will take longer).
Add salt as needed.
Cook on medium/slow flame for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until rice is soft.
Turn off the heat.
If desired, strain/drain the water; otherwise keep rice with water as desired.
tips: Soaked rice cooks faster than unsoaked rice.
You may strain the rice or keep the cooking water, as desired.

recipes.name: Sabudana Khichdi
recipes.description: A fasting-style sabudana khichdi cooked with potatoes, green chilies, roasted peanuts, and cumin tempering until the pearls turn slightly transparent.
instructions: Roast peanuts and coarsely crush them (half-crushed).
Soak sabudana for 4–5 hours; keep covered.
Heat oil; add cumin seeds.
Fry potatoes and green chilies.
Add soaked sabudana and mix.
Add salt and sugar; add crushed peanuts and mix.
Cook on low heat for about 15 minutes until sabudana becomes slightly transparent, stirring occasionally.
tips: Cook until the sabudana turns slightly transparent for best texture.

recipes.name: Fenugreek Fritters
recipes.description: Soft fried methi (fenugreek) gota made from besan-wheat batter with yogurt, rested, then leavened and deep fried.
instructions: Mix besan, wheat flour, green chilies, salt, sugar, turmeric, yogurt, and chopped methi together.
Rest the mixture for about 1 hour.
Add 1 tsp hot oil to the mixture.
Add baking soda and mix well.
Fry small balls (gota) in hot oil until cooked.

recipes.name: Poda (soaked batter snack) - partial
recipes.description: Partial recipe for a besan-based mixture with wheat and rice flour, dal, and vegetables; instructed to soak/rest before use.
instructions: Combine the listed ingredients.
Soak/rest for about 1/2 hour.

recipes.name: Poda (Besan-based Snack Batter)
recipes.description: A partially described besan-flour mixture with spices and chopped vegetables that is soaked/rested before use.
instructions: Combine besan, wheat flour, rice flour, dal, red chilli powder, salt, and chopped onion, tomato, and green chillies.
Soak/rest the mixture for about 1/2 hour.

recipes.name: Sambar
recipes.description: A South Indian lentil-and-vegetable stew flavored with sambar powder and finished with a mustard-hing tempering.
instructions: Cook the dal and mash it.
Cook the vegetables, adding water as needed.
Add tomatoes, sambar powder, turmeric, red chilli powder, and salt.
Add the cooked mashed dal and bring to a boil.
Prepare tempering: heat oil, add mustard seeds and hing.
Pour the tempering into the sambar.

recipes.name: Dosa (Fermented Rice and Urad Batter) - Version 1
recipes.description: A fermented dosa batter made from urad dal and rice, soaked and ground then fermented overnight before cooking.
instructions: Soak urad dal, rice, and the additional dal; then grind to a batter.
Ferment the batter overnight.
Add salt before making dosas.

recipes.name: Coconut Chutney with Tempering (Version 1)
recipes.description: A coconut chutney ground with chana dal, aromatics, and herbs, mixed with curd and finished with mustard-curry leaf tempering.
instructions: Grind coconut with chana dal, green chilli, ginger, and coriander leaves.
Add curd and mix.
Prepare tempering: heat oil, add mustard seeds, hing, and curry leaves.
Add the tempering to the chutney and mix.

recipes.name: Besan Sev
recipes.description: Crisp fried sev made by pressing a spiced besan dough/batter through a sev maker into hot oil.

ingredients.notes: as needed to make soft dough/batter

instructions: Mix besan with salt, red chilli powder, hing, turmeric, and enough water to make a soft dough/batter.
Press the mixture through a sev maker into hot oil.
Fry until crisp.

recipes.name: Dosa (with Methi) - Version 2
recipes.description: Crisp dosas made from a fermented batter of rice, urad dal, and a few fenugreek seeds, cooked on a hot tawa with ghee or oil.
instructions: Soak rice, urad dal, and methi for 4–5 hours.
Grind to a smooth batter.
Add salt and ferment overnight.
Heat a tawa/griddle.
Pour a ladle of batter and spread thin.
Apply ghee/oil and cook until crisp; flip if needed.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Chutney (Roasted Chana Dal and Peanut) - Version 2
recipes.description: A quick chutney made by grinding roasted chana dal and peanuts with ginger and green chilli, finished with mustard and curry leaf tempering.
instructions: Grind roasted chana dal, peanuts, ginger, green chilli, and salt with water to a chutney consistency.
Prepare tempering: heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add tempering to the chutney and mix.

recipes.name: Aloo Rava
recipes.description: A cooked, tempered tomato-ginger-chilli mixture served with boiled potatoes, finished with lemon and commonly eaten with sev and chopped onion.
instructions: Boil the potatoes (noted as done in the morning).
Make a mix by grating ginger, tomatoes, green chilies, and coriander together.
Heat oil; add mustard seeds.
Add the grated mix and cook on medium flame, stirring occasionally.
When the mixture starts leaving the sides of the pan, add lemon and salt.
Cook a little longer and serve as desired (eat with sev and chopped onion).
tips: Suggested serving: eat with sev and chopped onion.

recipes.name: Bhel Chutney (Jaggery Tamarind Chutney)
recipes.description: A sweet-tangy chutney made by boiling jaggery with tamarind and seasoning with spices and pani-puri masala, served after cooling.
instructions: Boil fresh jaggery and tamarind together; when it comes to a boil, simmer.
Add salt, chili powder, and pani-puri masala.
Cool and serve.

recipes.name: Garlic Chutney
recipes.description: A quick spicy chutney made by grinding garlic with tomatoes and red chilies, seasoned with salt.
instructions: Grind garlic, tomatoes, red chilies, and salt together, adding a little water as needed.

recipes.name: Chole
recipes.description: A chickpea curry cooked with onion-tomato base, ginger-garlic paste, and warming spices including bay leaves and garam masala.

ingredients.notes: included in paste with ginger/garlic/onion; quantity not specified

instructions: Cook/boil the soaked chickpeas (chana).
Make a paste of ginger, garlic, chilies, and onions.
Heat oil and sauté this paste.
Add tomato paste.
If needed, add a little besan.
Add all masalas.
Add the boiled chana and cook.
tips: If needed, add a little besan.

recipes.name: Bhel Chutney (Sweet Tamarind-Jaggery Chutney)
recipes.description: A sweet-tangy chutney made by boiling jaggery and tamarind, seasoned with spices for bhel/pani-puri.
instructions: Boil fresh jaggery and tamarind together; once it comes to a boil, simmer.
Add salt, chili powder, and pani-puri masala.
Cool and serve.

recipes.name: Ragda (White Peas Curry) for Ragda Patties
recipes.description: A simple white peas curry base used for assembling ragda patties, seasoned with turmeric and spices and served with sweet chutney.
instructions: Soak the dried white peas overnight.
Boil the peas until cooked.
Add turmeric, garam masala, and red chili powder and cook briefly to combine.
Serve with sweet chutney as part of ragda patties.

recipes.name: Potato Patties (for Ragda Patties)
recipes.description: Seasoned mashed potato patties formed into rounds, meant to be served with ragda and chutneys.
instructions: Boil the potatoes and mash them.
Add turmeric, salt, and hing and mix well.
Shape into round patties.

recipes.name: Dates-Tamarind Chutney (for Ragda Patties)
recipes.description: A sweet-tangy chutney made from dates and tamarind, seasoned with salt and chili; noted as prepared the same way as bhel chutney.
instructions: Prepare using the same method as bhel chutney: cook/boil the sweetener and tamarind component together, season with salt and red chili powder, then cool before serving.
tips: Text notes it is made the same way as bhel chutney.

recipes.name: Batata Vada
recipes.description: Spiced mashed-potato balls (vada filling) typically coated in besan batter and fried; this text includes the potato filling and batter mix.

ingredients.notes: for filling and batter; to taste

instructions: Boil the potatoes and mash them.
Add lemon, green chilies, coriander leaves, finely chopped onion, ginger-garlic paste, whole masala, garam masala, and salt; mix well.
Shape the mixture into balls.
For the besan batter: mix besan with chopped onion, red chilli powder, salt, garam masala, and hing; add water as needed to form a batter.

recipes.name: Dahi Vada
recipes.description: Soft fried urad-dal dumplings soaked in water, then served in curd/yogurt with sweet chutney and chili powder.
instructions: Soak urad dal for 2–3 hours.
Grind soaked dal with green chilies and salt, using minimal water.
Whip the batter well.
Heat oil and fry small vadas until cooked.
Soak fried vadas in water; after 5 minutes, squeeze out the water.
Place vadas into curd/yogurt.
Top with sweet chutney and red chilli powder.
tips: Do not add too much water while grinding.
Whip the batter well for lighter vadas.

recipes.name: Peanut Chutney for Fasting
recipes.description: A vrat-friendly chutney made with peanuts and boiled potato, blended with sour yogurt, salt, and cumin.
instructions: Grind the boiled potato and peanuts separately.
Combine and grind together to form a chutney.
Add sour curd/yogurt, salt, and cumin; blend well.
tips: Marked as suitable for fasting (vrat).

recipes.name: Chocolate Ice Cream (No-Churn Style)
recipes.description: A quick mixed-and-chilled ice cream using condensed milk, milk, cream, and cocoa/drinking chocolate, beaten briefly and chilled in stages.
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Beat with a mixer for 2–3 seconds and place in the fridge.
After 1/2 hour, mix again and place back in the fridge to set.
tips: Cocoa can be replaced with drinking chocolate (use the stated amounts).

recipes.name: Chocolate Nut Fudge
recipes.description: A condensed-milk fudge cooked with butter, sugar, cocoa, and nuts until it leaves the sides, then set and cut into squares.
instructions: Pour Milkmaid into a thick-bottomed pan.
Add butter and sugar.
Add cocoa and chopped nuts.
Stir on gentle heat until the mixture leaves the sides of the pan.
Pour evenly into a buttered dish and let it cool and set.
Cut into squares.
tips: Use a thick-bottomed pan and gentle heat to prevent sticking/burning.
Butter the dish before pouring for easier removal.

recipes.name: Siro (Semolina Halwa)
recipes.description: A ghee-roasted semolina halwa cooked with water and sugar, finished with cardamom and almonds.
instructions: Heat the ghee.
Add semolina and roast.
When it turns slightly red, add water.
Cook until the water dries up.
Add sugar and cook until the sugar dissolves.
Cover and cook on low heat.
Garnish with cardamom and almonds.

recipes.name: Wheat Siro (Wheat Flour Halwa)
recipes.description: A wheat-flour version of siro/halwa made by roasting flour in ghee and cooking with sugar, flavored with cardamom and almonds.

ingredients.notes: mentioned as alternative to ghee in text; unclear

instructions: Prepare using the same method as semolina siro: roast the flour in ghee, then cook with liquid and sugar, and finish with cardamom and almonds.

recipes.name: Gol Papdi
recipes.description: A set sweet made by roasting wheat flour in ghee and mixing with jaggery, then pressing and cutting into pieces.
instructions: Heat ghee and roast the wheat flour.
When it starts turning red, add chopped jaggery.
Mix well, cover, and let it set.
When firm, remove and cut into pieces.

recipes.name: Gajar Halwa (Carrot Halwa)
recipes.description: A milk-cooked carrot halwa sweetened with sugar and flavored with cardamom, finished with ghee.
instructions: Grate the carrots.
Cook/boil the grated carrots in milk.
When the milk dries up, add sugar.
Cook until the mixture dries.
Add ghee and cardamom.

recipes.name: Dudhi Halwa (Bottle Gourd Halwa)
recipes.description: A milk-cooked bottle gourd halwa prepared similarly to gajar halwa, sweetened and finished with ghee.
instructions: Grate the bottle gourd (dudhi).
Cook it in milk the same way as gajar halwa.
When the milk dries up, add sugar and cook until it dries.
Finish with ghee.
tips: Method stated to be the same as gajar halwa.

recipes.name: Mohanthal
recipes.description: A rich besan sweet roasted in ghee, cooled before adding sugar, then shaped and set.
instructions: Roast the besan (and coarse wheat flour) in ghee until the color changes.
Remove and spread on a plate to cool.
After it cools, add sugar (adding sugar while hot may release water).
Add cardamom.
Form into balls, press into a plate, and let it set.
tips: Add sugar only after the mixture cools; otherwise the sugar will release water.

recipes.name: Rice Kheer (Doodh Pak)
recipes.description: A creamy rice pudding made by slow-cooking milk with soaked rice, sugar, dry fruits, khoya, and aromatic spices.
instructions: Boil the milk on low flame, stirring continuously.
When the milk becomes thick, add the soaked rice and cook.
Add sugar.
Add chopped dry fruits, cardamom, saffron, and optional milk masala.

recipes.name: Fruit Salad with Custard
recipes.description: A simple milk custard base cooled and chilled, then mixed with fresh fruits shortly before serving.

ingredients.notes: e.g., apple, banana, pomegranate; add 1–2 hours before serving

instructions: Boil the milk with sugar.
Remove about 1/2 bowl/cup of milk and set aside.
Mix custard powder into the reserved milk and dissolve well.
Add this mixture back into the boiling milk and stir.
When it thickens, turn off the heat.
Stir for 5–10 minutes so it doesn’t form lumps.
Cool completely, then chill in the freezer.
Add fruits 1–2 hours before serving.
tips: Stir 5–10 minutes after turning off heat to prevent lumps.
Add fruits shortly before serving (1–2 hours) to avoid them turning soggy.

recipes.name: Shrikhand
recipes.description: A sweetened yogurt dessert made by dissolving sugar in ghee and mixing it into yogurt, then chilling until set.
instructions: Warm the ghee on low flame and add sugar.
When the sugar dissolves, remove from heat.
Add yogurt and mix well.
Beat/mix until smooth.
Refrigerate to set.
If too thick, mix in a little milk/water and refrigerate again.
tips: If shrikhand becomes too thick, loosen with a little milk or water and refrigerate again.

recipes.name: Bhakharwadi Filling (Masala)
recipes.description: A sweet-and-spiced cooked filling/masala intended for making bhakharwadi; cooled before use.

ingredients.notes: unspecified; to be added to sugar mixture
referenced but not fully specified; 'same as above'

instructions: Prepare the sugar mixture (referenced as 'same as above').
Add water first (as noted).
Add the masala to the sugar mixture and cook while hot.
Cool completely before using as filling.

recipes.name: Lapsi (Cracked Wheat Porridge/Dessert)
recipes.description: A cracked-wheat milk dessert cooked in a pressure cooker and enriched with ghee, khoya, and nuts, flavored with cloves and cardamom.
instructions: Mix lapsi with milk and pressure cook for about 3 whistles.
Add cloves and cardamom and cook.
Add ghee and cook.
Add khoya and a little water and cook.
Add almonds and dry fruits, then remove from the stove.

recipes.name: Rasgulla
recipes.description: Soft paneer balls cooked in sugar syrup using a pressure cooker method, then soaked to absorb syrup.
recipes.cook_time: 2 whistles (pressure cooker) + 10 minutes simmer (optional next-day step)

ingredients.notes: equal amount to lemon juice (for curdling) + double water for sugar syrup + hot water after cooking as needed

instructions: Boil the milk.
Dilute the lemon juice with an equal amount of water.
Stir the milk and slowly add the diluted lemon juice to curdle it.
Drain completely to obtain paneer (chhena).
In a cooker, combine sugar with double the water and bring to a boil.
While the syrup comes to a boil, knead the paneer while slightly hot until very soft; form small balls.
When the syrup boils, add paneer balls one by one.
Close the cooker and cook; open after two whistles.
After opening, add hot water so the paneer balls do not stick together.
For better soaking, leave in the cooker from afternoon till night.
If opening the cooker the next day, add water, cover, simmer for 10 minutes, then serve.
tips: Leaving rasgullas in the cooker/syrup longer helps them soak up syrup.
Keeps 7–8 days in the fridge.
Add hot water after pressure cooking to prevent balls from sticking.

recipes.name: Rava Ladoo (Semolina Ladoo)
recipes.description: Semolina ladoos made by mixing roasted rava with a hot 2-string sugar syrup and shaping into balls.

ingredients.notes: used with sugar for syrup (as written)

instructions: Roast rava in ghee and keep aside.
Add cardamom powder to the roasted rava.
In a pan, combine khoya with sugar and water and cook on high heat to make a thick 2-string syrup.
Check syrup consistency: a drop in water forms 1 string, then 2 strings; when 2 strings form, it is ready.
While the syrup is hot, add the roasted rava.
After 5 minutes, shape the mixture into balls (ladoo).
tips: Make the syrup on high heat and ensure it reaches a 2-string consistency before mixing.

recipes.name: Brinjal–Potato Stuffed Puri
recipes.description: Deep-fried puris stuffed with a spiced brinjal and potato mixture flavored with coconut, tamarind, and lemon.

ingredients.notes: for cooking stuffing (deep-frying oil not specified)

instructions: Wash brinjal and potatoes, cut into pieces, and pressure cook with a little water for 2 whistles.
Coarsely mash and set aside.
Heat oil in a pan; add the boiled brinjal–potato mixture and sauté.
Add coriander powder, red chilli powder, salt, grated coconut, and tamarind pulp; mix well.
Cook until the mixture becomes dry enough for stuffing.
Turn off the flame and add lemon juice.
Cool the stuffing before filling puris.

recipes.name: Kasar (Sweet Yogurt Sugar Syrup)
recipes.description: A thin, cooked sweetened yogurt-water mixture, strained smooth and served as a sweet drink/syrup.
instructions: Whisk curd well so there are no lumps.
Add water and mix well.
Strain to remove any lumps.
Cook covered on low heat for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat, add powdered sugar, and mix.

recipes.name: Stuffed Puri Dough
recipes.description: A maida-wheat flour dough for making stuffed puris, rolled like paratha and deep-fried.
instructions: Combine maida, wheat flour, ajwain, salt, and a little oil; make a puri-style dough.
Fill with prepared stuffing and roll like an aloo paratha.
Deep-fry until done.
Serve with aloo sabzi.
tips: Serve/eat with aloo sabzi (as noted).

recipes.name: Khichu (Aloo) / Crispy Spiced Urad Dal Fry
recipes.description: Soaked urad dal is coarsely ground with ginger, then tempered with spices and fried until crisp.
instructions: Soak urad dal for 8–10 hours.
Discard the remaining water.
Grind the dal coarsely and add ginger paste.
Heat oil and add cumin and hing.
Add turmeric, salt, and red chilli powder.
Add the ground dal mixture and fry until crisp.

recipes.name: Khichu (Aloo) - Fried Coarse Urad Dal Snack
recipes.description: Soaked urad dal is coarsely ground with ginger, tempered with spices, and fried until crisp.
instructions: Soak urad dal for 8–10 hours.
Discard the remaining soaking water.
Grind the dal coarsely and mix in ginger paste.
Heat oil; add jeera and hing.
Add haldi, salt, and red chilli powder.
Add the ground dal mixture and fry until crisp.

recipes.name: Missi Roti
recipes.description: A thick rolled roti made from wheat flour and besan, mixed with onions, green chillies, coriander, and spices.
instructions: Mix wheat flour, besan, salt, red chilli powder, green chillies, onions, fresh coriander, and oil.
Make a dough using curd or water (as for parathas).
Roll the roti slightly thick.

recipes.name: Toasted Sandwich (Potato-Tomato Masala Filling, Partial)
recipes.description: A brief, partial note describing a spiced potato mixture with tomatoes used for a toasted sandwich filling.
instructions: Prepare a seasoning with salt, red chilli powder, dhania/jeera, and sugar.
Add potatoes to the seasoning and cook until done.
Add tomatoes and masala, then turn off the heat.

recipes.name: Polao (Vegetable Pulao, Partial)
recipes.description: A brief pulao method where onions and tomatoes are fried with spices, then rice and vegetables are added.
instructions: Fry onions and tomatoes with garam masala, red chilli, salt, dhania/jeera, and haldi until well fried.
Wash and add 2 bowls of rice.
Add vegetables such as potatoes, capsicum, and peas.

recipes.name: Bhindi (Okra Stir-Fry, Partial)
recipes.description: Okra cooked with basic tempering and finished with amchur and spice powders; instructions are brief/partial.
instructions: Prepare seasoning (including jeera).
Add bhindi and cook until done.
Add spices/masala (aamchur, red chilli, salt, haldi, garam masala) and mix.
Cover and cook for some time.

recipes.name: Bhatura Dough (Partial)
recipes.description: A partial ingredient note for bhatura dough listing onion, green chilli, salt, and oil (method not provided).

recipes.name: Brinjal & Potatoes with Garlic
recipes.description: A brinjal-potato curry cooked with a garlic-ginger-chilli base, thickened with channa flour, and finished with amchur, jaggery, coriander, and lemon.
instructions: Heat oil and fry crushed garlic-ginger-chilli paste.
Add channa flour (besan) and fry.
Add red chilli powder, dhania-jeera powder, and garam masala.
Add brinjal and potatoes, then add salt and water.
Mix masala well, cover, and cook until vegetables are done.
Add amchur powder and jaggery.
Serve garnished with coriander and a little lemon juice.
tips: Optional: add onions by frying onions in the paste first, then add the masala.

recipes.name: Dry Aloo Matar
recipes.description: A dry-style potato and peas preparation tempered with cumin and seasoned with Navalkar masala, cooked covered with a little steam.

ingredients.notes: put some water on a lid (for steam cooking)

instructions: Heat oil and add jeera.
Add peas and potatoes.
Add salt and Navalkar masala; mix well.
Cook covered, placing some water on the lid to create steam, until done.
Finish with coriander.

recipes.name: Rajgira Puri (Amaranth Flatbread/Puri, Partial)
recipes.description: A rajgira (amaranth) dough prepared with hot water only, without salt or oil (brief note).
instructions: Use hot water to make the dough.
Do not add salt or oil.

recipes.name: Kanda Ni Bhakri (Onion Bhakri)
recipes.description: Wheat flour flatbread mixed with onions, green chillies, coriander, and extra oil, then fried in ghee.
instructions: Mix wheat flour with salt, green chilies, coriander, oil, and onions.
Rest the mixture; bind/adjust the dough while preparing.
Fry the bhakri using ghee.

recipes.name: Dahi Wada
recipes.description: Urad and moong dal wadas are fried, soaked in water, and used for dahi vada serving (final yogurt/seasoning steps not included).
instructions: Soak urad dal and moong dal for 4 hours.
Grind coarsely, adding ginger-chili and salt while grinding.
Heat oil for frying.
Mix the batter well by hand in a thali, then immediately shape and fry the wadas.
Put fried wadas into water and leave for 5 minutes.
Soak just before eating.

recipes.name: Goli Bhakri
recipes.description: Bhakri dough is made by heating oil and water together and using that mixture to bind wheat flour, then frying with ghee.

ingredients.notes: heated with oil; add approx. until oil soaks

instructions: Heat 1/2 cup oil with water (add approximately until the oil soaks).
Add wheat flour to a bowl, add the heated oil, and use the 'goli water' mixture to bind and make bhakri dough.
Fry using ghee.
