recipes.name: Pani (Rice Flour Dough Preparation, Partial)
recipes.description: A soft rice-flour dough flavored with green chili, ginger, yogurt, and turmeric; rested for several hours and cooked without oil/ghee (very brief note).

ingredients.notes: listed, but later note says do not use while frying

instructions: Mix rice flour with green chili, ginger, salt, dahi, and haldi to make a soft dough like roti dough.
Prepare the dough 3–4 hours before making.
Shape/cook it on a plastic bag.
Do not use oil or ghee while frying.
tips: Make the dough 3–4 hours in advance.
Cook on a plastic bag as the base.

recipes.name: Pani (Rice Flour Flatbread)
recipes.description: A soft rice-flour dough (roti-like) prepared ahead and cooked without adding oil or ghee during frying.
instructions: Mix rice flour with green chili, ginger, salt, dahi, and haldi to make a soft dough like roti (including ghee/oil as indicated in the ingredient list).
Make the dough 3–4 hours before cooking.
Shape/roll it on a plastic bag.
Cook on a hot surface; do not add any oil or ghee while frying.
tips: Make the dough 3–4 hours in advance.
Shape on a plastic bag.
Do not add oil or ghee during frying.

recipes.name: Bottle Gourd with Chana Dal
recipes.description: A pressure-cooked bottle gourd and chana dal curry tempered with spices and optionally tomatoes.
instructions: Heat oil and add hing, rai, and jeera.
Add dudhi, chana dal, haldi, salt, dhana-jeera, red chilli powder, jaggery, and optional tomatoes.
Pressure cook for 2 whistles.

recipes.name: Moong (Seasoned Boiled Moong)
recipes.description: Boiled moong prepared with spices and finished with a mustard-cumin tempering.
instructions: Boil the moong.
Add haldi, salt, red chilli powder, dhana-jeera, curry leaves, green chilli, ginger, and coriander.
Prepare a tempering with rai and jeera in oil and add it to the moong.

recipes.name: Choli (Boiled and Tempered Legume Dish)
recipes.description: Boiled choli cooked with basic spices and finished with a mustard-carom seed tempering.
instructions: Boil the choli.
Add haldi, salt, red chilli, and dhana-jeera.
Prepare a tempering with rai and ajmo in oil and add it.

recipes.name: Black Chana (Boiled and Seasoned)
recipes.description: Black chickpeas soaked overnight, boiled, and seasoned with spices and a hing tempering.
instructions: Soak black chana overnight.
Boil the chana.
Add haldi, salt, and red chilli powder.
Add a tempering of hing (in oil).
tips: You can also add chole masala.

recipes.name: Oadaman (Seasoned Dal Water)
recipes.description: A seasoned preparation made by tempering spices and adding them to dal water, then finishing with lemon, sugar, and herbs.
instructions: Heat oil and add hing, rai, jeera, cloves, and cinnamon.
Add this tempering to the dal water.
Add salt, lemon, sugar, haldi, green chillies, and coriander.

recipes.name: Masoor (Seasoned Boiled Masoor with Yogurt)
recipes.description: Masoor cooked with onions and spices, finished with a hing tempering and some yogurt.
instructions: Boil the masoor, adding onions while boiling.
Add haldi, salt, and red chilli powder.
Add a tempering of oil and hing.
Finally add some dahi.

recipes.name: Vatana (Spiced Peas with Jaggery and Tamarind)
recipes.description: Soaked and boiled vatana finished with a mustard-cumin tempering and sweet-sour flavors from jaggery and tamarind.
instructions: Soak vatana overnight and boil them.
Heat oil with rai and jeera and add the vatana.
Add haldi, salt, red chilli powder, jaggery, and tamarind.

recipes.name: White Peas (Seasoned)
recipes.description: White peas soaked overnight, boiled, then seasoned with hing and basic spices.

ingredients.notes: soak overnight; boil in the morning

instructions: Soak white peas overnight.
Boil them in the morning.
Heat oil with hing, add the peas, then add haldi, salt, red chilli, and dania-jeera.

recipes.name: Black Peas (Seasoned)
recipes.description: Black peas soaked and boiled, then seasoned similarly to the white peas version.
instructions: Soak black peas overnight and boil them.
Heat oil with hing, add the peas, then add haldi, salt, red chilli, and dania-jeera.

recipes.name: Green Peas (Seasoned)
recipes.description: Green peas prepared using the same simple hing-and-spice seasoning method as the other peas.
instructions: Prepare green peas using the same method as the white peas: season in oil with hing and add haldi, salt, red chilli, and dania-jeera.

recipes.name: Rajma (Spiced Kidney Beans with Yogurt)
recipes.description: Soaked kidney beans boiled with a little baking soda, then cooked with onions and spices and finished with yogurt.
instructions: Soak rajma overnight.
Boil in the morning, adding a little soda/bi-carb while boiling.
Fry onions in oil with hing.
Add the boiled rajma to the onions.
Add haldi, salt, red chilli powder, and garam masala.
Add some dahi.

recipes.name: Thepla (Basic Spice Dough)
recipes.description: A basic thepla dough seasoning list using turmeric, spices, hing, oil, and water (method not fully specified).
instructions: Combine haldi, salt, pepper, dania-jeera, hing, oil, and water to make thepla dough (additional flour/cooking steps not provided in the source text).

recipes.name: Raw Dhokla (Rawa Dhokla)
recipes.description: A steamed semolina (rawa) dhokla made by soaking rawa in sour buttermilk, then aerating with baking soda and finishing with a mustard-curry leaf-sesame tempering.
instructions: Soak rawa in sour buttermilk for at least 1/2 hour.
Add ginger, green chillies, and salt to the batter.
Heat oil and water together; when it starts boiling, add soda bi-carb and immediately add it into the batter.
Prepare a seasoning/tempering with rai, curry leaves, and til and add it.
Top with fresh coriander and fresh coconut.

recipes.name: Uttapa (Rawa and Channa Flour, Vegetable)
recipes.description: A savory uttapa-style batter made from rawa and channa flour soaked in sour buttermilk, mixed with grated vegetables and aromatics.
instructions: Mix 2 cups rawa and 1 large tbsp channa flour.
Soak the mixture in sour buttermilk for 1/2 hour.
Add salt.
Add grated cabbage, carrot, capsicum, onions, dudhi, and tomatoes.
Add ginger-chillies.
Optionally add pepper and jeera powders.
tips: You can also add pepper & jeera powders.

recipes.name: Eggless Cake (from cake mix)
recipes.description: A simple eggless cake prepared using a packaged cake mix combined with vegetable oil and milk.
instructions: Blend the cake mix, vegetable oil, and milk according to package instructions.

recipes.name: Kopra Pak
recipes.description: A coconut-based sweet cooked in ghee with condensed milk, saffron milk, sugar, and cardamom.

ingredients.notes: fried/roasted in ghee (described as 'Fry coconut roast')

instructions: Fry/roast the coconut in ghee.
Add 1 can condensed milk.
Add a little kesar milk.
Cook on low heat, stirring continuously.
Add sugar as needed.
Add elaichi (cardamom).

recipes.name: Tomato Curry (No Onion)
recipes.description: A simple tomato-based curry made without onions, finished with a little sugar to balance acidity.

ingredients.notes: ratio note: '1 onion = 3 tomatoes' (no onion used)
a little; added at the end

instructions: Heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin, and asafoetida; fry (temper).
Add tomatoes (using the note that 1 onion is equivalent to 3 tomatoes) and cook.
Add turmeric, red chili powder, and coriander powder; cook until masala is fried.
Finish by adding a little sugar.

recipes.name: Punjabi Mixed Vegetable Curry
recipes.description: Punjabi-style mixed vegetable curry with a fried onion-ginger-garlic-chili paste, finished with kasuri methi and cream.
instructions: Boil all vegetables except capsicum (and keep optional vegetables as desired).
Make a paste of onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili.
Heat oil and fry capsicum.
Add the paste and fry well.
Add tomatoes and chili paste.
Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala; fry the masala.
Add the boiled vegetables and cook together.
Finish by adding kasuri methi and cream.
tips: Optional additions: paneer, cauliflower, and corn.
Capsicum is fried separately and not boiled with the other vegetables.

recipes.name: Raw Papaya Sabzi (with Curd-Spice Mix)
recipes.description: A quick raw papaya curry where spiced curd is added to fried tomatoes, then raw papaya is briefly cooked.
instructions: Heat ghee and add cumin and asafoetida for tempering.
Fry tomatoes.
In a bowl, mix curd with coriander powder, turmeric, and red chili powder until well combined.
Add the spiced curd mixture to the tomatoes.
Add raw papaya pieces.
Cook for a few minutes, then switch off the gas.

recipes.name: Onion, Potato, and Tomato Curry (Pressure Cooker)
recipes.description: A pressure-cooker curry made by frying a paste and onions, then adding tomatoes and raw potatoes with spices.
instructions: Prepare tempering with mustard seeds and cumin in oil.
Fry the paste in oil (paste details partially unclear), then add onions and fry.
Add tomatoes and cook briefly.
Add raw potatoes.
Add salt, black pepper, turmeric, red chili powder, and coriander powder.
Cook in a pressure cooker until potatoes are done.
tips: One ingredient is unclear in the source text: 'homemade (not read)'.
